titleStmt.title: To GILBERT À BECKETT,Gilbert Abbott à Beckett (1811-56); police magistrate (hence ‘Beakish’); journalist, prolific playwright and humorous writer. Recommended suitable candidates for Urania Cottage, which Mary Richardson probably was, although there is no further mention of her. 9 FEBRUARY 1854

opener.salute: My dear aThus in MS. Beckett.

body.p: I hope it is not unconstitutional to find a trifle of difficulty sometimes, in deciphering Beakish caligraphy.Thus in MS.A “mysterious appearance” in your letter looks to me more like Monday (in the list of your official days) than any thing else. Assuming it to be the sign or symbol of Monday, I will come on Monday at The name ‘Mary Richardson’ is written (in a different hand) on a scrap of paper and pasted into the letter., to see Mary Richardson4
Gilbert aThus in MS.à Beckett Esquire
